description: five lines of cursive on yellow and dark blue mount
inscription: Living in this world is like a great dream, / Why should I labor my who[le] life long? / Therefore I spend the day drinking / And, dejected, sleep by the front door. / Waking, I look around the courtyard, / And see a bird singing among the flowers. / I ask what season could this be? / Spring wind is conversing with the flying orioles. / Reflecting, I am on the verge od sighing, / Drinking wine, I turn back to myself / And sing until the bright moon rises; / When the song is over, I have fergotten my melancholy.  (SA)

title: Poem in Cursive Script
